content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining and Storage Facility at Position (x=40.5, y=-83.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=41.0, y=-82.0) connected to a wooden chest at position (x=40.5, y=-83.5) for coal storage.
- Wooden chest at position (x=41.5, y=-83.5) for additional storage.
- Transport belt connecting the mining drill to the storage chests.

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (x=0.0, y=0.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=0.0, y=0.0) for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=1.5, y=0.5) for transferring items into the furnace.
- Wooden chest at position (x=2.5, y=0.5) for storing iron plates.
- Transport belt and inserters facilitating the movement of materials.

### Copper Plate Production Facility at Position (x=10.0, y=0.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=10.0, y=0.0) for smelting copper ore into copper plates.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=11.5, y=0.5) for transferring items into the furnace.
- Wooden chest at position (x=12.5, y=0.5) for storing copper plates.
- Transport belt and inserters facilitating the movement of materials.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when Extracting Items
- Ensure the target entity has sufficient inventory of the item you wish to extract. If the inventory is empty or does not contain the specified item, extraction will fail.

### Errors with Full Storage
- Regularly check and empty storage chests to prevent blockages in production. A full chest will halt the operation of connected entities like mining drills.

### Errors with Inserters Waiting for Source Items
- Ensure that the source entities have items available for inserters to transfer. If the source is empty, the inserter will remain idle and production will be delayed.
